projects.title: Decolonizing Criminology Initiative
projects.description: A comprehensive initiative to transform criminology education and research by centering Indigenous, Black, and other non-Western epistemologies. This project includes curriculum development, faculty training, and community partnerships.
projects.impact: Reached 500+ students, trained 25 faculty members, established partnerships with 8 community organizations
outcomes: Developed 6 new courses incorporating decolonial perspectives
Published pedagogical toolkit adopted by 12 universities
Established community advisory board for curriculum oversight

projects.title: LGBTQ+ Justice Policy Reform
projects.description: Led policy reform efforts to improve treatment of LGBTQ+ individuals in NYC criminal justice system, including training programs for law enforcement and development of affirming protocols.
projects.impact: Trained 1,200+ officers, reduced discriminatory incidents by 40%, established LGBTQ+ liaison program
outcomes: Implemented mandatory LGBTQ+ cultural competency training
Established safe housing protocols for transgender individuals

projects.title: Environmental Justice and Incarceration Study
projects.description: Community-based participatory research examining the relationship between environmental racism and criminal justice involvement in Brooklyn neighborhoods.
projects.impact: Documented environmental-criminal justice connections in 15 neighborhoods, informed 3 policy proposals

projects.title: Narrative Healing Circles Program
projects.description: Developed and implemented narrative-based healing circles for formerly incarcerated individuals and their families, focusing on identity reconstruction and community reintegration.
projects.impact: Served 200+ participants, 85% successful reintegration rate, expanded to 5 community centers

projects.title: Criminal Justice Reform Coalition
projects.description: Co-founded and led statewide coalition advocating for criminal justice reform, focusing on bail reform, sentencing reform, and police accountability measures.
projects.impact: Contributed to passage of 3 major reform bills, mobilized 10,000+ advocates, secured $50M in reform funding

projects.title: Restorative Justice in Schools Program
projects.description: Implemented restorative justice practices in 15 Brooklyn schools to reduce suspensions and improve school climate, with particular focus on supporting Black and Latino students.
projects.impact: Reduced suspensions by 60%, improved graduation rates by 15%, trained 200+ educators
outcomes: Established restorative justice protocols in 15 schools

researchAreas.title: Social Identity Theory of Shared Narrative
researchAreas.description: Exploring how collective narratives shape individual and group identities within criminal justice contexts, with particular attention to marginalized communities.

researchAreas.title: Affective Architecture
researchAreas.description: Investigating the emotional and psychological dimensions of criminal justice spaces and how they impact both practitioners and those processed through the system.

researchAreas.title: Decolonizing Criminology
researchAreas.description: Challenging traditional criminological frameworks through Indigenous, Black, and other non-Western epistemologies to create more inclusive and just approaches.

researchAreas.title: LGBTQ+ Justice
researchAreas.description: Examining the unique experiences of LGBTQ+ individuals in criminal justice systems and developing affirming, trauma-informed approaches to justice.

researchAreas.title: Ecological Justice
researchAreas.description: Connecting environmental harm with social justice, exploring how ecological destruction disproportionately affects marginalized communities.

currentResearchProjects.title: Narrative Identity and Reentry Success
currentResearchProjects.description: A longitudinal study examining how formerly incarcerated individuals construct and reconstruct their identities during reentry, with focus on narrative coherence and community support.

currentResearchProjects.title: Queer Criminology Pedagogy Project
currentResearchProjects.description: Developing inclusive curriculum and teaching materials that center LGBTQ+ experiences in criminology education.

currentResearchProjects.title: Environmental Racism and Criminal Justice
currentResearchProjects.description: Investigating the intersection of environmental harm and criminal justice involvement in communities of color.
